org.jetel.util.file

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.file.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class with some useful methods regarding file manipulation
    Since:
    May 24, 2002

      static java.util.List<java.io.InputStream> getTarInputStreams(java.io.InputStream innerStream, java.lang.String anchor, java.util.List<java.lang.String> resolvedAnchors)
      Deprecated. 
      This method does not really work, it is not possible to open multiple TarInputStreams from one parent input stream without extensive buffering. Use getMatchingTarEntries(InputStream, String) to resolve wildcards or getTarInputStream(InputStream, String) to open a TarInputStream.

      static java.lang.String normalizeFilePath(java.lang.String path)
      This method affects only windows platform following way: backslashes are replaced by slashes if first character is slash and device specification follows, the starting slash is removed For example: c:\project\data.txt -> c:/project/data.txt
      /c:/project/data.txt -> c:/project/data.txt A path reached from method anUrl.getPath() (or anUrl.getFile()) should be cleaned by this method.
      static java.lang.String removeInitialDotDir(java.lang.String path)
      Removes "./" sequence from the beginning of a path
      static java.lang.String removeTrailingSlash(java.lang.String path)
      Deletes last directory delimiter.

      • getFileURL

        public static java.net.URL getFileURL(java.net.URL contextURL,
                      java.lang.String fileURL)
                               throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Creates URL object based on specified fileURL string. Handles situations when fileURL contains only path to file (without "file:" string).
        Parameters:
        contextURL - context URL for converting relative to absolute path (see TransformationGraph.getProjectURL())
        fileURL - string containing file URL
        Returns:
        URL object or NULL if object can't be created (due to Malformed URL)
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • getFileUrls

        public static java.net.URL[] getFileUrls(java.net.URL contextUrl,
                         java.lang.String[] fileUrls)
                                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Converts a list of file URLs to URL objects by calling getFileURL(URL, String).
        Parameters:
        contextUrl - URL context for converting relative paths to absolute ones
        fileUrls - array of string file URLs
        Returns:
        an array of file URL objects
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if any of the given file URLs is malformed

      • calculateFileCheckSum

        public static long calculateFileCheckSum(java.lang.String filename)
        Calculates checksum of specified file.
        Is suitable for short files (not very much buffered).
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename (full path) of file to calculate checksum for
        Returns:
        Calculated checksum or -1 if some error (IO) occured

      • getReadableChannel

        public static java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel getReadableChannel(java.net.URL contextURL,
                                                       java.lang.String input)
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates ReadableByteChannel from the url definition.

        All standard url format are acceptable plus extended form of url by zip & gzip construction:

        Examples:
        zip:<url_to_zip_file>#<inzip_path_to_file>
        gzip:<url_to_gzip_file>
        Parameters:
        contextURL - context URL for converting relative to absolute path (see TransformationGraph.getProjectURL())
        input - URL of file to read
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getInputStream

        public static java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.net.URL contextURL,
                                 java.lang.String input)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates InputStream from the url definition.

        All standard url format are acceptable plus extended form of url by zip & gzip construction:

        Examples:
        zip:<url_to_zip_file>#<inzip_path_to_file>
        gzip:<url_to_gzip_file>
        For zip file, if anchor is not set there is return first zip entry.
        Parameters:
        contextURL - context URL for converting relative to absolute path (see TransformationGraph.getProjectURL())
        input - URL of file to read
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.IOException

                                                       java.lang.String input,
                                                       boolean appendData,

        Creates WritableByteChannel from the url definition.

        All standard url format are acceptable (including ftp://) plus extended form of url by zip & gzip construction:

        Examples:
        zip:<url_to_zip_file>#<inzip_path_to_file>
        gzip:<url_to_gzip_file>
        Parameters:

        input -
        appendData - - for file and ftp
        compressLevel - - for zip
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public static void createParentDirs(java.net.URL contextURL,
                    java.lang.String fileURL)
                             throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Creates the parent dirs of the target file, if necessary. It is assumed that the target is a regular file, not a directory. The parent directories may not have been created, even if the method does not throw any exception.

        contextURL -
        fileURL -
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • getInnerInput

        public static java.util.regex.Matcher getInnerInput(java.lang.String source)
        Finds embedded source. Example: source: zip:(http://linuxweb/~jausperger/employees.dat.zip)#employees0.dat result: (g1) zip: (g2) http://linuxweb/~jausperger/employees.dat.zip (g3) #employees0.dat
        Parameters:
        source - - input/output source
        Returns:
        matcher or null

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        File representation

      • normalizeFilePath

        public static java.lang.String normalizeFilePath(java.lang.String path)

        This method affects only windows platform following way:

        • backslashes are replaced by slashes
        • if first character is slash and device specification follows, the starting slash is removed

        For example:

        c:\project\data.txt -> c:/project/data.txt
        /c:/project/data.txt -> c:/project/data.txt

        A path reached from method anUrl.getPath() (or anUrl.getFile()) should be cleaned by this method.

        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:

      • convertUrlToString

        public static java.lang.String convertUrlToString(java.net.URL url)
        Standardized way how to convert an URL to string. For URLs with 'file' protocol only simple path is returned (for example file:/c:/project/data.txt ->c:/project/data.txt) The URLs with other protocols are converted by URL.toString() method.
        Parameters:
        url -
        Returns:

      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly(java.io.Closeable closeable)
        Quietly closes the passed IO object. Does nothing if the argument is null. Ignores any exceptions thrown when closing the object.
        Parameters:
        closeable - an IO object to be closed

      • closeAll

        public static void closeAll(java.lang.Iterable<? extends java.io.Closeable> closeables)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Closes all objects passed as the argument. If any of them throws an exception, the first exception is thrown. The remaining exceptions are added as suppressed to the first one.
        Parameters:
        closeables -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copyFile

        public static boolean copyFile(java.io.File source,
               java.io.File target)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Efficiently copies file contents from source to target. Creates the target file, if it does not exist. The parent directories of the target file are not created.
        Parameters:
        source - source file
        target - target file
        Returns:
        true if the whole content of the source file was copied.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteRecursively

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isMultiURL

        public static boolean isMultiURL(java.lang.String fileURL)

        Parameters:
        fileURL -
        Returns:
        true if and only if the given string represents multiple URL

      • getAbsoluteURL

        public static java.lang.String getAbsoluteURL(java.net.URL contextURL,
                              java.lang.String fileURL)
                                       throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Converts fileURL to absolute URL. Preserves wildcards and escape sequences. Handles multiple URLs separated with a semicolon. Handles nested URLs. Examples: "sandbox://sandboxname/" + "data-in/file.txt" = "sandbox://sandboxname/data-in/file.txt" null + "data-in/file.txt" = "file:/C:/Current/Working/Directory/data-in/file.txt" "sandbox://sandboxname/" + "zip:(data-in/archive.zip)#file.txt" = "zip:(sandbox://sandboxname/data-in/archive.zip)#file.txt" "C:/some/dir" + "data-in/*.txt" = "file:/C:/some/dir/data-in/*.txt"
        Parameters:
        contextURL -
        fileURL -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
